author: cmpilato

author: kfogel
msg: Resolve issue #1302:
Handle the case where a CVS file is first added on a branch, so the
RCS file starts out in the Attic with revision 1.1 in state "dead",
and the case where two successive revisions are both in state "dead".
These two cases actually overlap, and can probably be handled by
shared logic.  But that will require some other changes, and my first
priority is to get these bugfixes in for the 0.23 release.
* tools/cvs2svn/cvs2svn.py
(TreeMirror.delete_path): If the path can't be reached, return None.
(Dump.delete_path): If the path didn't exist in the head tree
mirror, then don't output a delete to the dumpfile.  Return 1 if
actually deleted a path, None if not.
(Commit.commit): Don't even bother to delete revision 1.1 of a file,
and don't output a revision unless there was some activity.

author: dws
msg: * packages/rpm/redhat-8.x/subversion.spec : Instead of requiring python 2.2.1
or greater, just require python 2 or greater.

author: kfogel
msg: Insist on Python 2.0 or higher:
* tools/cvs2svn/cvs2svn.py: Check sys.hexversion.
